issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
In system mode I tried to run 2 BFEBS instances concurrently with start times seconds apart. The instances went to running and were pingable but I was not able SSH to them. After terminating those I tried to launch another instance which would display the initial describe instances response but subsequent describe instances request did not show the instance.

Setup available at:
192.168.51.6
root/foobar

CLC log during the time of the run instance shows:
{code}
2013-04-12 00:12:28 DEBUG 000001321 ClusterAllocator         | Queued StartNetwork: AsyncRequest:callback=AsyncRequest:StartNetworkCallback ExtantNetwork:de
fault:tag=-11:indexes=[]:

2013-04-12 00:12:28 DEBUG 000006625 SystemUtil               | Running command: //usr/lib/eucalyptus/euca_rootwrap losetup -f
2013-04-12 00:12:28 ERROR 000001321 Allocations              | Aborting resource token: ResourceToken:i-3E234360:
java.lang.RuntimeException
        at com.eucalyptus.cloud.run.Allocations$Allocation.abort(Allocations.java:279)

fields.summary: System mode: Launched 2 bfebs instances concurrently, now unable to launch any

comments.body: Worked with [~viglesias] on this for a bit. The SSH problem was likely due to the use of a cloud-init-based BfEBS image in SYSTEM mode. We were not able to reproduce the launch problem, as illustrated by the stack trace.
Is the update here that this issue is not reproducible?  Does this belong on the C2J list?
I have not been able to reproduce this. Will re open if I see it again.

There's an issue like this in eucalyptus 3.2. In System mode, I run 2  EBS instances one after another, not use -n 2. the ERROR message as follows. Then I can't run any instance instance-backend or ebs. Reboot Eucalyptus or System cannot resolve it. At last I reinitialize the database, but all data are lost.
